page.title: 02Playground games.Ashford C.
page.content: Children at Ashford Carbonell school play various games,some old,some new.Children usually play in groups and sometimes the whole school is involved in playing a particular game.Games can be grouped into ball games,chasing games,skipping games and pretending games.'British Bulldogs' is a favourite game.This is how you play it:There is a person in the middle and when he calls your name you have to get past him without getting caught but if he says British Bulldog you all have to get past.If he tigs you,you have to help him to catch the others. If you have another game,the first person caught is 'on.In Autumn,conkers are popular with the boys.In cold weather, skidding and snowball fights are favourites.At Ashford School we have a climbing frame and a slide which we like playing on at any time.
